abstract:
With the aim of building a ”Semantic Web”, the content of the documents must be explicitly represented through metadata in
order to enable contents-guided search. Our approach is to exploit a standard language (RDF, recommended by W3C) for expressing
such metadata and to interpret these metadata in conceptual graphs (CG) in order to exploit querying and inferencing capabilities
enabled by CG formalism. The paper presents our mapping of RDF into CG and its interest in the context of the semantic Web.
